author: Camilo Clavel
title: C√≥mo hacer un puff para tu hogar con s√≥lo unos baldes de pintura reciclados
text:
Poder decorar el hogar de la manera m√°s econ√≥mica posible no es solo conveniente para el bolsillo de quienes lo realizan, sino que adem√°s pone a prueba la creatividad y el ingenio. Un ejemplo es convertir un viejo balde de pintura en un glamuroso puff para cualquier espacio de tu casa. Este proyecto es perfecto para quienes desean ahorrar dinero, evitar compras costosas y aportar un toque √∫nico y personalizado a su hogar.
Materiales necesarios
Este reciclaje requiere materiales accesibles y un poco de imaginaci√≥n. Para realizarlo vas a necesitar: un balde de pintura vac√≠o y limpio, pintura en aerosol de color blanco, una pistola de silicona, tela dorada, goma espuma, hilo grueso y aguja, una piedra decorativa, tijeras, tiras de piedras, patas para la base y una abrochadora.
El paso a paso para reciclar los baldes de pintura
- El primer paso es cubrir el balde con pintura en aerosol blanca para eliminar cualquier marca o logo visible. Esto garantizar√° una base uniforme y prolija.
- Luego tom√° la tela de purpurina dorada y forr√° toda la superficie visible del balde. Us√° tijeras para recortar los sobrantes y asegurate de cubrir tambi√©n la base inferior con un c√≠rculo de tela a medida.
- Despu√©s segu√≠ con la decoraci√≥n utilizando tiras de piedras o cristales. Coloc√° una tira en la parte inferior del balde, otra bajo el borde superior de la tapa y distribu√≠ las restantes alrededor del borde.
- Estas decoraciones a√±aden un toque sofisticado que eleva el dise√±o final. Utiliz√° una agujereadora para realizar un orificio en el centro del balde; este ser√° fundamental para fijar el almohad√≥n.
- El almohad√≥n se hace forrando un trozo de goma espuma con la misma tela dorada. Pas√° hilo grueso a trav√©s de la goma espuma y fij√° una piedra decorativa en el centro para darle un aspecto elegante.
- Repet√≠ este proceso en el lado interno del almohad√≥n, a√±ad√≠ un c√≠rculo de tela para cubrir la parte inferior, que deber√°s fijar con una abrochadora para darle estabilidad.
- Termin√° el proyecto colocando patas decorativas en la base del balde. Ajustalas firmemente con tornillos para que el puff tenga un soporte estable y resistente. Este √∫ltimo paso no solo mejora la funcionalidad del mueble, sino que tambi√©n le aporta un acabado refinado.
En pocos pasos y con materiales sencillos, pod√©s transformar un simple balde en un puff glamuroso para tu hogar.

author: LISA RESPERS FRANCE, CNN
title: Cher files for conservatorship of son Elijah Blue Allman
text:
Cher has filed for temporary legal conservatorship of her adult son Elijah Blue Allman, citing his alleged ongoing substance abuse issues.
According to a petition filed this week in Los Angeles Superior Court and obtained by CNN, Cher is seeking to be the sole conservator of her son‚Äôs estate, alleging that he ‚Äúis currently unable to manage his assets due to severe mental health and substance abuse issues.‚Äù
‚ÄúElijah is entitled to regular distributions from the Trust, but given his ongoing mental health and substance abuse issues,‚Äù according to the documents. ‚ÄúPetitioner (Cher) is concerned that any funds distributed to Elijah will be immediately spent on drugs, leaving Elijah with no assets to provide for himself and putting Elijah‚Äôs life at risk.‚Äù
The 47-year-old is the son of Cher and her former husband, the late rocker Gregg Allman.
People are also reading‚Ä¶
Gregg Allman and Cher were married from 1975 to 1979. He
died in 2017 at the age of 69 due to liver cancer complications.
The petition filed by Cher states that her son is set to receive funds from a trust by the end of the year. It also states that the 77-year-old singer and actress has ‚Äúworked tirelessly to get Elijah into treatment and get him the help he needs.‚Äù
‚ÄúPetitioner (Cher) loves Elijah immensely and has always acted with his best interests in mind,‚Äù the filing states.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm not suffering from any problem that millions of people in the United States aren‚Äôt,‚Äù
Cher told People magazine in October, referring to her son‚Äôs substance abuse.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm a mother. This is my job ‚Äî one way or another, to try to help my children,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúYou do anything for your children. Whenever you can help them, you just do it because that‚Äôs what being a mother is. But it‚Äôs joy, even with heartache ‚Äî mostly, when you think of your children, you just smile and you love them, and you try to be there for them.‚Äù
Cher is also the mother of Chaz Bono.
A hearing has been scheduled in March, according to court documents. CNN is working to determine if Allman has legal representation.
CNN has reached out to representatives for Cher for further comment.

author: ANI
title: UP ranks first in the Inter-Operable Criminal Justice System
text: UP ranks first in the Inter-Operable Criminal Justice System Uttar Pradesh has ranked first for the third consecutive year in recording the highest entry rate on the Inter-Operable Criminal Justice System LUCKNOW: Uttar Pradesh has consistently ranked first for the third consecutive year in recording the highest entry rate on the Inter-Operable Criminal Justice System (ICJS) platform, conceptualized by the Supreme Court's e-committee and implemented by the Ministry of Home Affairs. Notably, the ICJS platform facilitates the seamless transfer of data and information among various pillars of the criminal justice system nationwide. In these, data related to crimes and criminals is exchanged between courts, police, jails, and forensic science laboratories through a single window system. ADG Prosecution Deepesh Juneja said that the Directorate of Prosecution Uttar Pradesh has recorded 1,56,22,514 entries on the ICJS platform so far. Madhya Pradesh is in second place with 35,04,828 entries, and Bihar is in third place with 16,65,107 entries. Through ICJS, records such as FIR, case numbers, jail ID, and records from filing FIRs against suspects to imprisonment of culprits are maintained. Additionally, details of court cases, trials, judgments, prosecution, and forensic information can be accessed by courts, police, jails, and forensic science laboratories through a single platform. Information related to criminal justice related to the investigation, search, case history, case pendency, current status of the criminal, etc. required from time to time is also available on ICJS. The police department gets help in data analytics for the prediction of crimes based on this information and effective management of crime control in the future. In addition to this, photographs, videos, documentary evidence as well as court case data, and video recordings of court proceedings related to crimes and criminals are also preserved on ICJS. Furthermore, it facilitates the enablement of judicial proceedings through video conferencing.

organizations.name: inter-operable criminal justice system uttar pradesh

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Did Donald Trump Jr just break the law during his meeting with Hungarian leader Viktor Orban?
text:
By Katie Hawkinson ,
37 minutes ago Donald Trump Jr, four months after being hit with a $4 million fine and a ban on serving as an officer of a New York company for two years , is seeking opportunities elsewhere ‚Äî namely, Hungary .
The former president‚Äôs eldest child arrived in Budapest on Thursday morning on an invitation from the Budapest Chamber of Commerce and Industry. There, he met with Prime Minister Viktor Orb√°n and gave a talk entitled ‚ÄúThe World According to Donald Trump Jr .,‚Äù an event first reported by Hungarian journalist Szabolcs Panyi .
Trump Jr‚Äôs visit focused on discussions about ‚Äúthe future of Hungarian-American relations, the ongoing Russian-Ukrainian war, and opportunities for peace creation,‚Äù according to Zoltan Kovacs , spokesperson for Orb√°n‚Äôs office.
Multiple legal experts say foreign policy discussions between Trump Jr ‚Äî who is not employed by the US government ‚Äî and a foreign prime minister raise questions about the Logan Act, which prohibits unauthorized diplomatic activity in certain circumstances.
Experts also tell The Independent the Hungarian government‚Äôs increasingly authoritarian tilt may serve as a model for Trump‚Äôs potential second presidency , should he win the election this November ‚Äî and that Americans should pay attention as his eldest son speaks not only to Orb√°n but a prominent conservative college with ties to Orb√°n‚Äôs Fidesz party.
The Trump campaign did not respond to multiple requests for comment from The Independent .
The Logan Act Trump Jr ‚Äî who met with Orb√°n to discuss immigration, Russia‚Äôs war in Ukraine, and US-Hungarian relations ‚Äî followed in his father‚Äôs footsteps. The former president met with Orb√°n in March.
But Kim Scheppele, Professor of Sociology and International Affairs at Princeton University and Faculty Fellow at the University of Pennsylvania Law School, says this raises legal questions about Trump Jr‚Äôs role.
‚ÄúThere is an interesting US legal question about whether private citizens can attempt to influence US foreign policy by negotiating with foreign countries,‚Äù Scheppele told The Independent . ‚ÄúThe Logan Act makes this illegal.‚Äù
Specifically, Trump Jr, who does not hold any government office, spoke with Orb√°n regarding US foreign policy as it relates to Ukraine.
Yet, the Logan Act states that any US citizen ‚Äúwithout authority of the United States, directly or indirectly,‚Äù is not legally permitted to conduct ‚Äúany correspondence or intercourse with any foreign government or any officer or agent thereof, with intent to influence the measures or conduct of any foreign government‚Äù when it comes to conflict situations.
Donald Baker, former assistant attorney general at the US Department of Justice, told The Independent it is unlikely the Department would ever pursue action against anyone using the Logan Act, given no one has been convicted of violating the 1799 law: ‚Äú Any action by the Justice Department would be unwise because it would be jumped all over as being political, given the Act really hasn‚Äôt been regularly invoked. ‚Äù
But Baker said he believes Donald Trump Jr‚Äôs discussions about Ukraine raise questions: ‚ÄúObviously Orb√°n is opposed to helping Ukraine, has blocked the EU from making a substantial payment to Ukraine, and so therefore he is an ally of the Trump people.‚Äù
An example of a Logan Act violation that could have taken place during those discussions, Baker added, would be if ‚ÄúTrump Jr encouraged Orb√°n not to release the funds‚Äù or encouraged him ‚Äúto go on blocking the EU‚Äôs funds for Ukraine.‚Äù
Baker told The Independent there needs to be more consideration of the Logan Act in light of recent news: ‚ÄúThis is a subject we ought to be discussing.‚Äù
He added that the former president‚Äôs discussion with Orb√°n earlier this year was also concerning under the Logan Act.
‚ÄúTo have the Republicans‚Äô likely candidate taking a position on foreign policy [as it relates to Russia and Ukraine], getting close to actively opposing what the administration is doing, is a worrying situation we ought to be talking about,‚Äù Baker told The Independent .
An ultra-conservative ‚Äòtraining ground‚Äô Trump Jr was also scheduled to speak on Thursday afternoon at Mathias Corvinus Collegium (MCC), a conservative Hungarian residential college. The event is not listed on the college‚Äôs public website as of Thursday.
Scheppele says the college serves as a ‚Äútraining ground‚Äù for members of Orb√°n‚Äôs Fidesz party. She said the college is where conservative leaders gather to determine how to keep the party in power.
‚ÄúThe MCC is a training ground for the young people who are going to go into Orb√°n‚Äôs government,‚Äù Scheppele told The Independent .
The MCC was founded in 1996 with private money from the Fidesz party. In 2021, The New York Times reported that Orb√°n had funneled $1.7 billion in government funds and assets to the college as he prepared to seek re-election the following year.
Scheppele said one of the primary functions of the MCC is to maintain Orb√°n‚Äôs hold on Hungary: ‚Äú[The MCC] is also the idea factory for the Orb√°n government: ‚ÄòHow can we adjust the laws so we never lose power?‚Äô‚Äù
Under Orb√°n, Hungary is in a democratic backslide. Freedom House rates Hungary as only ‚Äúpartly free,‚Äù noting the country‚Äôs anti-immigration and anti-LGBTQ+ policies, as well as policies ‚Äúthat hamper the operations of opposition groups, journalists, universities, and nongovernmental organizations.‚Äù
Like father, like son Trump Jr‚Äôs father and the Hungarian prime minister also have a long-standing allyship.
Orb√°n went as far as to call the former president his ‚Äúgood friend‚Äù earlier this year when the duo met in Washington, DC. Meanwhile, Scheppele told The Independent, Trump ‚Äî who famously threatened to become a dictator on day one of his potential second presidency ‚Äî may be looking to Orb√°n as a model for policy.
Richard Benson, a senior policy analyst with the Center for American Progress, told The Independent it is dangerous for American voters to subscribe to ‚ÄúAmerican exceptionalism‚Äù and to assume the democratic backsliding in Hungary can‚Äôt possibly happen in the US.
‚ÄúI think our institutions are resilient ‚Äî but that resiliency demands a careful eye,‚Äù Benson said. ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt take it for granted that we‚Äôre simply going to be okay. If you talk to Hungarians, they didn‚Äôt expect it to happen the way it did.‚Äù
There are several parallels between Trump and Orb√°n‚Äôs policies.
Trump has made his far-right, anti-immigration stance clear since day one of his 2016 presidential campaign. Similarly, Orb√°n has expressed radical views on immigration since 2015 ‚Äî and in 2022, he said he did not want Hungarians to become ‚Äúpeoples of mixed race.‚Äù
The pair have also both tossed aside NATO and its processes. The former president has threatened to violate NATO by allowing Russia to attack member states ; meanwhile, Orb√°n delayed a vote on Sweden‚Äôs membership for 18 months. As a result, the country was not admitted until this yea r .
Both Scheppele and Benson also pointed to Project 2025, a conservative playbook for the next presidential administration. Along with replacing supposedly impartial federal officials with fellow conservatives, Project 2025 also calls for several policy revisions, such as re-adding the citizenship question to the US Census.
Orb√°n‚Äôs success leading an ‚Äúauthoritarian‚Äù government relied on ‚Äúdecapitating‚Äù the civil service and replacing it with his extremist allies, which mirrors the Project 2025 strategy, Scheppele told The Independent .
Wes Coopersmith, the Chief of Staff for the Heritage Foundation who oversees Project 2025, previously told The Independent that replacing employees with Republican allies if Trump is elected would be ‚Äúdemocratic.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe think the most democratic way to run the administration is with folks who agree with the president, who voted for the president, who agree with his policies and want to implement that,‚Äù Coopersmith said.
Orb√°n‚Äôs suddenly uncertain future Just days ahead of Trump Jr‚Äôs scheduled visit, the European Parliament elections threw Orb√°n into an unprecedented, weakened position .
‚ÄúOrb√°n, for the first time in 14 years, has a real electoral problem,‚Äù Scheppele told The Independent.
While the Fidesz party still received more votes than any other Hungarian party, they will only make up eleven of Hungary‚Äôs 21 EU delegates. What‚Äôs more, this weekend marked their worst performance since 2004 ‚Äî long before Orb√°n‚Äôs reign began in 2010.
‚ÄúI think he assumed that he was just going to, as usual, swamp the vote,‚Äù Scheppele said.
The politician responsible for bringing the Fidesz party numbers down is P√©ter Magyar, a former Fidesz insider who is now looking to end Orb√°n‚Äôs rule.
‚Äú[Orb√°n] is still winning, but he has lost so much support,‚Äù Scheppele said. ‚ÄúThe fact that the emperor has no clothes is suddenly visible.‚Äù
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: Davey Winder
title: 2 Million Facebook, Instagram And WhatsApp Accounts Deleted‚ÄîHere‚Äôs Why
text:
Meta has confirmed that every day criminals are using text messaging, dating apps, social media and email to further scams and fraud, most commonly what are known as pig-butchering scams whereby victims are fleeced into fraudulent investment schemes. But Meta is fighting back and, across 2024 alone, it has closed down more than two million accounts being used by organized crime for this purpose on Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp. Here‚Äôs what you need know.
Forbes Now Hackers Are Using Snail Mail In Cyber Attacks‚ÄîHere‚Äôs How By Davey Winder Facebook, Instagram And WhatsApp Accounts Closed By Meta As Organized Crime Groups Targeted In a Nov. 21 report, ‚Äú Cracking Down On Organized Crime Behind Scam Centers ,‚Äù Meta has detailed just how it is taking action to target organized crime groups behind pig-butchering scams in Myanmar, Laos, Cambodia, the United Arab Emirates and the Philippines. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre going after the criminal organizations behind pig butchering and other schemes,‚Äù Meta said, ‚Äú which target people globally through messaging, dating, social media and crypto and other apps to convince them to invest under false pretenses.‚Äù
This report represents the first time that Meta has shared details of how it approaches the countering of cross-border criminal activity, in particular those organizations behind forced-labor ‚Äúscam compounds.‚Äù Meta has a Dangerous Organizations and Individuals safety policy that makes it clear there is no place on Facebook, Instagram or WhatsApp ‚Äúfor groups or individuals that promote violence, organized crime, hate or terrorism.‚Äù
The Meta intelligence report reveals how criminally operated scam compounds are put into play which force workers to engage in everything from cryptocurrency and loan fraud, to the type of pig-butchering already mentioned. ‚ÄúWe assess that much of the scam centers‚Äô activity is tightly scripted by criminal syndicates to scale their operations,‚Äù Meta said, ‚Äúit includes some forced-labor scammers focusing on casting a wide net online to ‚Äòspray and pray‚Äô by reaching out to a large number of people via text message or online with a relatively generic appeal in hopes that some of them will respond.‚Äù
Elon Musk Apparently Just Became The No. 1 ‚ÄòDiablo 4‚Äô Player In The World Stop Using Your Passwords‚Äî1Password And Google Warn No, Your Gmail Isn‚Äôt Truly Private‚Äî2 Ways To Fix That Forbes Don‚Äôt Hold Down The Ctrl Key‚ÄîNew Warning As Cyber Attacks Confirmed By Davey Winder Scammers Target Facebook, Instagram And WhatsApp Meta explained in the intelligence analysis report how scammers usually start their attacks on dating apps, or by text message, email, social media such as Facebook and Instagram, or by way of messaging apps such as WhatsApp . All of this is a pretence to moving the conversation, and that scam attack itself, into an environment where it can be more closely controlled by the criminal gangs, such as crypto apps or scam websites.
Meta said that it set up critical partnerships with key external partners in order to ensure it is taking a holistic approach to defending users against a wide range ion such scams. This means that, during the past two years, Meta has ‚Äústood up teams and systems to help identify and go after these scam hotspots globally under our DOI and safety policies.‚Äù These actions can be broken down into four main categories:
Dangerous organizations and individuals policy: used to disrupt organized crime, continuously investigate and assess criminal organizations and, once identified, banning them from all Meta platforms. On-platform enforcements: the monitoring of these dangerous organizations and individuals as they attempt to circumvent account banning enforcement. This includes looking for new scam compounds globally and continuously disrupting their operations, Meta said. Working with others: part of the focus of Meta operations is to counter and deter others from using its platforms for illegal purposes. ‚ÄúWe know that these are extremely persistent and well-resourced criminal organizations working to evolve their tactics and evade detection,‚Äù Meta said, ‚Äúthis makes collaboration within industries and countries even more critical.‚Äù Law enforcement: and finally, as part of the threat disruption effort, Meta works with global law enforcement to share intelligence and help them protect their communities wherever they are. Forbes Google‚Äôs Gmail And Photos Deletion Warning As 1-Year Timer Expires By Davey Winder Meta Rolling Out New Protective Features Across Facebook, Instagram And WhatsApp Platforms Meta also has an infographic to help users spot scams and stay safe online.
Meta concluded this new threat intelligence report by confirming that it is constantly rolling out new product features, across its Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp platforms, to help protect users from scammers at scale. ‚ÄúWe will show you a warning in Messenger and Instagram DMs reminding you to be aware of potentially suspicious interactions or cold outreach from people you don‚Äôt know,‚Äù Meta said, ‚Äúso you can slow down and review before accepting a message request. On WhatsApp, Meta explained, if you‚Äôre added to a group chat by someone you don‚Äôt know, ‚Äúyou‚Äôll now see a context card giving you more information about the group‚Äîit‚Äôll show who added you, how recently the group was created and who created it so you have context on this outreach.‚Äù
Forbes Gmail Users Beware‚ÄîLink Hovering Attacks On The Up By Davey Winder
